text: â€˜Table 2 Mediators produced by pulmonary endothelial cells and their mechanism for modulating HPV Mediator Mechanism Nitric oxide Although not fully understood, nitric oxide is continuously produced by pulmonary endothelial cells and maintains a con- stant state of pulmonary dilatation by reducing intracellular calcium, relaxing smooth muscle. Hypoxia reduces basal nitric oxide production and thus HPV is enhanced Prostacyclin Prostacyclin is a vasodilator that stimulates cyclic adenylate cyclase and increases cyclic adenine monophosphate production Endothelin-1 Endothelin-1 is a small peptide paracrine mediator with potent vasoconstrictor properties. It acts via G-protein receptors on PASMCs
